controls.title: Ensure interactive boot is not enabled
controls.description: Interactive boot allows console users to interactively select which services start on boot. Not all distributions support this capability. The PROMPT_FOR_CONFIRM option provides console users the ability to interactively boot the system and select which services to start on boot.
controls.rationale: Turn off the PROMPT_FOR_CONFIRM option on the console to prevent console users from potentially overriding established security settings.
controls.remediation: If interactive boot is available disable it.

v6: 5.1 Minimize And Sparingly Use Administrative Privileges

controls.title: Ensure mounting of cramfs filesystems is disabled
controls.description: The cramfs filesystem type is a compressed read-only Linux filesystem embedded in small footprint systems. A cramfs image can be used without having to first decompress the image.
controls.rationale: Removing support for unneeded filesystem types reduces the local attack surface of the server. If this filesystem type is not needed, disable it.
controls.audit:
Run the following commands and verify the output is as indicated:
# modprobe -n -v cramfs
install /bin/true
# lsmod | grep cramfs
<No output>
controls.remediation:
Edit or create a file in the /etc/modprobe.d/ directory ending in .conf
Example: vim /etc/modprobe.d/cramfs.conf
and add the following line:
install cramfs /bin/true
Run the following command to unload the cramfs module:
# rmmod cramfs
